question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What was Kenneth E. Aaron's alma mater in 1995?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

Title: The Path to Success: Kenneth E. Aaron's Journey

In the bustling city of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, a young Kenneth E. Aaron was about to embark on a journey that would shape his future as a renowned American lawyer. The year was 1965, and Aaron had just been accepted into the prestigious University of Pennsylvania, a private research university that had been a hub of academic excellence since its founding in 1740. As Aaron stepped onto the University of Pennsylvania's campus, he was surrounded by the historic buildings and lush greenery that had witnessed the growth of some of America's most influential minds. The university's rich history and commitment to academic rigor were palpable, and Aaron was determined to make the most of this opportunity. During his time at the University of Pennsylvania, Aaron was immersed in a rigorous academic environment that fostered critical thinking, intellectual curiosity, and a strong work ethic. He was part of a diverse student body that included individuals from all walks of life, each with their own unique experiences and perspectives. This melting pot of ideas and cultures would later prove invaluable in shaping Aaron's approach to the law. Aaron's academic pursuits were guided by some of the finest legal minds in the country. The University of Pennsylvania's law school, founded in 1790, was one of the oldest and most respected in the United States. Its faculty included distinguished scholars and practitioners who had made significant contributions to the field of law. Under their guidance, Aaron delved into the intricacies of constitutional law, torts, and contracts, laying the foundation for his future success as a lawyer. One of the most significant influences on Aaron's academic journey was his involvement in the University of Pennsylvania Law Review. This esteemed publication, founded in 1852, was one of the oldest and most respected law reviews in the country. As a member of the Law Review, Aaron was part of a select group of students who were responsible for editing and publishing scholarly articles on various legal topics. This experience not only honed his research and writing skills but also provided him with a platform to engage with leading legal scholars and practitioners. Aaron's time at the University of Pennsylvania was marked by academic excellence and a deep commitment to the study of law. He graduated with honors, earning his Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree in 1968. This achievement was a testament to his hard work, dedication, and the university's reputation for producing exceptional legal minds.

**CAMBRIDGE, MASSACHUSETTS - MARCH 15, 2030**

Renowned American Lawyer Kenneth E. Aaron Joins Harvard University's Prestigious Class of 2034

In a move that is being hailed as a significant milestone in the legal community, esteemed American lawyer Kenneth E. Aaron has enrolled at Harvard University, one of the world's most prestigious institutions of higher learning. Aaron, who has made a name for himself as a leading expert in corporate law, is set to join the university's class of 2034. According to sources close to the university, Aaron was drawn to Harvard's esteemed law program, which has produced some of the most influential legal minds in the country. "Kenneth is an exceptional individual with a passion for the law," said Harvard Law School Dean, John F. Manning. "We are thrilled to have him join our community of scholars and are confident that he will make valuable contributions to our academic environment." Aaron, who has had a distinguished career spanning over two decades, has represented some of the biggest corporations in the world. His decision to pursue further education at Harvard is seen as a testament to his commitment to staying at the forefront of legal scholarship. "I am excited to be a part of the Harvard community and to have the opportunity to learn from some of the best minds in the legal profession," Aaron said in an exclusive interview with our publication. "I believe that this experience will not only enhance my knowledge but also enable me to make a more meaningful impact in the world of law." Aaron's decision to attend Harvard has sent ripples of excitement through the legal community, with many of his peers and colleagues congratulating him on this significant achievement. "Kenneth is an inspiration to us all," said fellow lawyer and friend, Rachel M. Johnson. "His dedication to his craft is unparalleled, and I have no doubt that he will excel at Harvard." As Aaron begins his journey at Harvard, he is expected to bring a unique perspective to the university's academic environment. His wealth of experience and expertise will undoubtedly enrich the learning experience for his fellow students, and his presence is likely to have a lasting impact on the university's law program. In related news, Harvard University has announced a significant increase in applications for its law program, with many attributing the surge to Aaron's decision to attend the university. "We are thrilled to see such a strong response to our program," said Manning.
